abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Programmatic
            Reform Loan for Environmental Sustainability Project for
            Brazil were as follows: outcome was moderately satisfactory;
            risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank performance
            was moderately satisfactory; and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            risks associated with not completing the required ex-post
            evaluation of an operation go beyond the operation itself.
            The World Bank should therefore have ensured that the
            evaluation of the previous series was completed before
            embarking on preparation of a new series in the same sector.
            Extensive engagement and consultations by the World Bank in
            preparing a development policy operation (DPO) contribute to
            better design and generate goodwill on the part of the
            client. It is important to be selective and realistic about
            what can be achieved in the context of a sectoral DPO.
